H0.text: Shape would most help pollinators find flowers that are pollinated at night.

H1.text: Color would most help pollinators find flowers that are pollinated at night.

H2.text: Size is the factor that would most help pollinators find flowers that are pollinated at night.

H3.text: Fragrance is the factor that most helps pollinators find flowers that are pollinated at night.

A4.text: Nocturnally-visited tobacco plants have the highest floral scent emissions at night.

A5.text: Floral scent emissions of most flowering plants vary predictably throughout the day, following a circadian rhythm.
